page.title: 19Sutton on Trent
page.content: Sutton on Trent is a pleasant little village in the Trent Valley.It lies between the A.1.(Old Great North Road) to the West and the River Trent to the East.There have been many prehistoric finds dredged from the river at this point,including fossilized mammoth's teeth and tusks. Roman and Anglo Saxon pottery have also been unearthed.There is a fine medieval church.The village site would seem to be an ancient one,based on an old river crossing,a ferry to the now extinct village of Meering,(in Sutton Parish).The farms and cottages range in age from 300 year old timber cottages to present day developments.A disused tower mill dominates Main St.to the South.The Council are in favour of moderate development and light industry is encouraged to the village.Sutton remains a living,working village.
